synonyms: gati—movement of the legs (walking, running, etc.); ukti—speech; utsarga—evacuation; upādānam—accepting with the hands; ānanda—the material pleasure of the sex organs; sparśa—touch; lakṣaṇam—sight; āsvāda—taste; śruti—hearing; avaghrāṇam—smell; aham—I am; sarva-indriya—of all the senses; indriyam—the potency to experience their objects.
translation: I am the functions of the five working senses—the legs, speech, anus, hands and sex organs—as well as those of the five knowledge-acquiring senses—touch, sight, taste, hearing and smell. I am also the potency by which each of the senses experiences its particular sense object.
